plugin.name: Hypothes.is
plugin.summary: This plugin integrates the Hypothes.is annotation tool into articles.
plugin.description: This plugin integrates Hypothes.is (http://hypothes.is) in OJS articles, permitting annotation and commenting. (See the README document for notes on PDF support.)

plugin.name: Shibboleth
plugin.summary: This plugin adds Shibboleth support.
plugin.description: This plugin allows third-party authentication via a Shibboleth service.

plugin.name: Translator
plugin.summary: This plugin permits translations to be updated and edited.
plugin.description: This plugin allows site administrators to edit the translation files that ship with the software. See https://pkp.sfu.ca/wiki/index.php/Translating_OxS for information on translation management and contributing back.

plugin.summary: This plugin permits backups to be downloaded from within OJS.
plugin.description: This plugin allows site administrators to download backups of the system.

plugin.name: iThenticate
plugin.summary: This plugin permits automatic submission of uploaded content to the iThenticate service for plagiarism checking.
plugin.description:

See the README document included in this plugin for installation instructions.

plugin.name: COinS
plugin.summary: This plugin embeds OpenURL COinS in OJS articles.
plugin.description: This plugin embeds OpenURL COinS (http://ocoins.info/) in OJS articles, permitting tools like Zotero (http://www.zotero.org) to grab citations.

plugin.summary: The QuickSubmit plugin permits Journal Managers to quickly enter submissions through the OJS website, bypassing the editorial workflow.

plugin.name: Allowed Uploads
Sallitut tiedostomuodot
plugin.summary: Allowed Uploads plugin enables to choose the filetypes that are allowed when submitting a manuscript.
Tämän lisäosan avulla voit rajoittaa niitä tiedostomuotoja, joita voi lähettää käsikirjoituksen yhteyteen.
plugin.description:
Allowed Uploads plugin enables to choose the filetypes that are allowed when submitting a manuscript.

NOTE! This is not a security plugin! Please make sure that the files directory is outside the web root.

Tämän lisäosan avulla voit rajoittaa niitä tiedostomuotoja, joita voi lähettää käsikirjoituksen yhteyteen.

HUOM! Tätä lisäosaa ei ole tarkoitettu parantamaan järjestelmän tietoturvaa! Huolehdi, että järjestelmän tiedostot-hakemisto on sijoitettu tai suojattu oikein.

release.description: Initial release of the Allowed Uploads plugin.
Updated release of the Allowed Uploads plugin.
Update for compatibility with v3.2.

plugin.name: Funding
plugin.summary: Adds submission funding data using the Crossref funders registry.
plugin.description: This plugin adds submission funding data using the Crossref funders registry, considers the data in the Crossref and DataCite XML export and displays them on the submission view page.

plugin.summary: Permits the addition of custom headers to the website.

Release of the custom headers plugin for OJS/OMP 3.1.2.
Release of the custom headers plugin for OJS/OMP/OPS 3.2.0.

plugin.name: JATS Template Plugin
plugin.summary: Permits the automatic generation of a simple (incomplete) JATS XML document.
plugin.description: This plugin permits the automatic generation of a simple JATS XML document where a better file is not otherwise available. This can be used e.g. in connection with the OAI JATS plugin to deliver metadata in a JATS format.

release.description: Initial release of the JATS Template plugin.
Minimum Viable Product (MVP) release of the JATS Template plugin for Coalition Publi.ca.
Compatibility release of the JATS Template plugin for OJS 3.2

plugin.name: SWORD Deposit Plugin
plugin.summary: Permits the use of the SWORD protocol to deposit documents from OJS into other systems.
plugin.description:
This plugin permits the use of the SWORDv2 protocol to allow OJS to deposit documents into other systems.

The deposit can be performed manually, automatically upon acceptance, and manually by the author.

release.description: Initial release of the SWORD plugin.
Maintenance release of the SWORD plugin.
Maintenance release of the SWORD plugin.
Maintenance release of the SWORD plugin.
Maintenance release of the SWORD plugin.

plugin.name: OAI JATS Plugin
plugin.summary: Permits the delivery of JATS XML via the OAI interface.
plugin.description: This plugin permits the delivery of JATS XML via the OAI interface. Note that it does not generate the JATS document itself -- this will need to be done using the JATS Template Plugin, or using an external tool such as Open Typesetting Stack.

release.description: Initial release of the OAI JATS plugin.

plugin.summary: An official theme that plays on colour and font contrasts based on literary classicism.

plugin.name: Health Sciences
plugin.summary: An official theme designed to maximize legibility and content clarity.
plugin.description: An official theme designed for health science journals or any journal that wants a clean, modern appearance. The theme features a light grey-blue color scheme that evokes medical settings, but the color can be changed to fit any journal's needs.

release.description: Initial release.

plugin.name: Manuscript (Default child theme)
plugin.summary: A clean, simple theme with a boxed layout that mimics a paper document.
plugin.description: A clean, simple theme with a boxed layout that mimics a paper document. It features a similar layout as the default theme, with a different look and feel for your OJS 3 journal. You can customize the primary and accent colors to match your branding.

release.description: Initial release.
This release provides a few updates to improve compatibility with OJS 3.1, and adds a German translation.
This release provides a few updates to improve compatibility with OJS 3.1.1/3.1.2, and updates the German and Spanish translations.
This release makes the theme compatible with OJS v3.2.

plugin.name: Texture plugin
plugin.summary: Integrates the Substance Texture JATS XML Editor with OJS.
plugin.description: This plugin integrates the Texture JATS XML editor with OJS, permitting in-place editing of article content.

release.description: This is the initial release of the plugin.
This is a compatibility release of the plugin for OJS 3.1.2.

This release upgrades Texture to version 2.2.0.1
This release adds support for importing and exporting the DAR format.
This release adapts the plugin for compatibility with OJS 3.2 and support for importing and exporting the DAR format.

plugin.name: Crossref Reference Linking Plugin
plugin.summary: Automatically add the extracted article references to the DOI registration with Crossref
plugin.description:
This plugin will automatically add the extracted article references to the DOI registration with Crossref. Crossref will then automatically check if any DOIs can be found for the submitted references. Shortly after that, the user can use the plugin to check for the found references DOIs, either automatically or manually in the submission metadata tab "References". If article references change once they are registered, the article DOI withe the new references will have to be registered anew. Then the check for the found references DOIs should be done again.

This plugin requires Crossref DOIs to be assigned to articles, article references to be separately entered and extracted, as well as article DOIs to be deposited to Crossref from within OJS. It uses the Crossref Export/Registration plugin settings: Crossref credentials (username and password), the setting for the automatic DOI deposit (here for automatic references DOIs check), as well as the setting for the testing mode.

release.description: This is the initial release of the plugin.

plugin.name: Immersion
plugin.summary: An official theme focused on full-page visuals, large typefaces, and bold color blocks.
plugin.description: The Immersion theme emphasizes the reading experience and offers bold design options such as a full-width header image and per-section color choices. This theme may work best for arts and culture journals which want to present a more ambitious visual profile.

release.description: Initial release.
Bugfix release.
Bugfix release.
Compatibility release.
This adds an option to display the journal description on the journal landing page. It also fixes a bug related to issue galleys and an error that occurred when creating a new issue.
This release makes the theme compatible with OJS v3.2.
Bugfix release.

plugin.name: ORCiD Profile
plugin.summary: ORCiD integration for users and authors
plugin.description: The ORCiD Profile plugin integrates support for ORCiD identifiers for authors and users. This includes tools to submit new content to an author's ORCiD profile.

maintainer.name: Dulip Withanage; Clinton Graham; Nils Weiher
maintainer.institution: Public Knowledge Project; Pittsburgh University; Heidelberg University

plugin.name: Default Translation
plugin.summary: Make OJS fall back on English when elements of the software translation are missing.
plugin.description: This plugin, when enabled, will cause OJS to fall back on the English language translations for elements of the software that haven't been translated into the user's language.

release.description: Initial release for OJS 3.x.
Initial release for OJS/OMP/OPS 3.2.

plugin.name: Paperbuzz
plugin.summary: Display free altmetrics based on open data from Paperbuzz.
plugin.description: This plugin will display free altmetrics based on open data from Paperbuzz, a free and open service built by Impactstory that itself relies on Crossref Event Data. To use this plugin, your journal must have DOIs assigned to articles and properly deposited with Crossref.

release.description: Initial release.

plugin.name: OpenAIRE Plugin 2.0
plugin.summary: This plugin adds a new OAI-PMH metadata format to Open Journal Systems that complements the OpenAIRE Guidelines for Literature Repository Managers v4.
plugin.description: For detailed instructions, see plugin Readme file https://github.com/ojsde/openAIRE/blob/master/readme.md.

release.description: OpenAIRE 2.0 plugin for OJS 3.1.1
OpenAIRE 2.0 plugin for OJS 3.1.1

plugin.name: Lens Viewer for Monographs and Journal Articles
plugin.summary: An extended version of the Lens Viewer that supports books and articles.
plugin.description:
This plugin provides an extended version of the Lens Viewer with support for books with BITS extensions. It also supports articles.

Do not use this plugin alongside the official Lens Viewer plugin. Only use one or the other, depending on your needs.

release.description: Initial release.

plugin.name: ReviewerCredits Plugin
plugin.summary: This plugin enable the integration with ReviewerCredits (www.reviewercredits.com).
plugin.description: This plugin enable the integration with ReviewerCredits using REST APIs. The main goal is to create and approve Peer Review Claims on the ReviewerCredits website.

release.description: Plugin to enable the integration with ReviewerCredits. First release.

plugin.name: Plum Analytics Artifact Widget
plugin.summary: This plugin integrates Plum Analytics' Artifact Widget.
plugin.description: This plugin provides display of PlumX Metrics from Plum Analytics on the article level for PKP Open Journal Systems.

release.description: Release of the Plum Analytics plugin for OJS 3.1.1/3.1.2.

plugin.name: SUSHI-Lite
plugin.summary: This plugin adds SUSHI-Lite (draft) support.
plugin.description: This plugin provides the NISO SUSHI-Lite standard (2015 draft release) for PKP software.

release.description: Release of the SUSHI-Lite plugin for OJS 3.1.1/3.1.2.

plugin.name: Better Password
plugin.summary: This plugin adds user restrictions when selecting passwords.
plugin.description: This plugin provides additional password restriction options when users are selecting their own password. Please review the NIST recommendations in the README before using arbitrary password complexity requirements.

release.description: Release of the Better Password plugin for OJS/OMP 3.1.2.

plugin.name: Akismet
plugin.summary: This plugin integrates the Akismet anti-spam service.
plugin.description: This plugin verifies new user registrations via the Akismet anti-spam service. Subscription to Akismet is required.

release.description: Release of the Akismet plugin for OJS 3.1.1 and OJS/OMP 3.1.2.

plugin.name: Form Honeypot
plugin.summary: This plugin adds a honeypot to user registration.
plugin.description: This plugin verifies new user registrations by creating a honeypot on the User Registration form.

release.description: Release of the Form Honeypot plugin for OJS 3.1.1/3.1.2.

plugin.name: Author Requirements
plugin.summary: Make certain author fields optional.
plugin.description: This plugin makes it possible to add an author to a list of contributors without using certain requried fields (e.g. email). This is useful in cases where required information does not exist for authors.

release.description: Initial release of the authorRequirements plugin for OJS/OMP 3.1.x
Release of the authorRequirements plugin for OJS/OMP 3.2.0

plugin.name: Registration Notification
plugin.summary: Sends an email notification to a configurable list of emails whenever a new user is registered.
plugin.description:
Once enabled, the plugin will send an email notification to a configurable list of emails, configurable per journal/press, whenever a new user is registered. The plugin also supports setting up the email template using variables.

See https://github.com/pkp/registrationNotification/blob/master/README.md for details.

release.description: Registration Notification Plugin v1.0.0.2 (Compatible with OJS/OMP 3.1.1).
Registration Notification Plugin v2.0.0.1 (Compatible with OJS/OMP 3.1.2).

plugin.name: Control Public Files
plugin.summary: Limit who can upload public files and what kind of files they can upload.
plugin.description:
Users can upload images wherever they are presented with a rich text editor that includes the image upload control. This includes places like the About the Journal section as well as the user biography in every user's profile area.

This plugin provides settings to restrict who can upload, what kind of files they can upload, and how large their directory of files can grow.

release.description: Initial release for OJS/OMP v3.2.

plugin.name: Text Editor Extras
plugin.summary: Add controls to the rich text editor to upload images, manipulate the HTML code, and add tables.
plugin.description: This plugin provides settings to turn on extra controls for the rich text editor and to specify which fields should receive the additional controls.

release.description: Initial release for OJS/OMP v3.2.
This update fixes a bug that prevented image uploads from working in some configurations.

plugin.name: Twitter Block Plugin
plugin.summary: This plugin adds a block to display a Twitter feed in the sidebar.
plugin.description:
This plugin makes it easy to include Twitter feeds in a multi-journal instance without the need to create several custom blocks.

Check the how to use guide.

release.description: Initial release

plugin.name: Announcements Block
plugin.summary: This plugin adds a block to display announcements in the sidebar.
plugin.description:
This plugin makes it easy to show the latest announcements in the sidebar. It allows you to specify how many announcements are displayed.

Check the "how to use" guide on GitHub

maintainer.name: Ronny Bölter
maintainer.institution: Leibniz Institute for Psychology Information, Trier, Germany

plugin.name: Publons Reviewer Recognition Plugin
plugin.summary: This plugin enables integration with Publons Reviewer Recognition Service.
plugin.description: In order to provide your reviewers with the opportunity to gain recognition for their reviews on Publons, please register your interest with Publons by visiting https://publons.com/benefits/publishers. Our accounts team will then be in touch to discuss your options and provide further instructions on how to integrate your journal with Publons.

release.description: Minor improvements for Portuguese translations.
